title: [BUG]: unable to run mlflow projects on windows 10

labels.name: needs author feedback
labels.description: Issue is waiting for the author to respond

body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**:
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows 10
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: source
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.7.1
- **Python version**: 3.7.6
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**:
- **Exact command to reproduce**:  mlflow run testproject
-**Anaconda3

### Describe the problem
i am trying to run mlflow project by execute the following command on anaconda powershell prompt using administrative privileges 
mlflow run <foldername>

I followed two steps: 
**Step 1**
MLFLOW_CONDA_HOME: environment variable set:  D:\anaconda (anaconda installation folder)

while trying to run a mlflow project, I am getting the following error:

ERROR mlflow.cli: === Could not find Conda executable at D:\anaconda\bin/conda. Ensure Conda is installed as per the instructions at https://conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/install/index.html. You can also configure MLflow to look for a specific Conda executable by setting the MLFLOW_CONDA_HOME environment variable to the path of the Conda executable ===
(base) PS D:\DataScience\learning\P14-Machine-Learning-AZ-Template-Folder\Part_12_MLFlow\projects>

there is no bin folder created by anaconda in windows 10. The mlflow cli always looks for the bin folder. if i specify d:\anaconda\Library\bin as the path of environment variable i get some scripting error. 

**Step 2**
1.  Removed the environment variable and added conda to my path variable 
2.  execute the following command on anaconda powershell prompt using administrative privileges
mlflow run <projectfolder directory>
3. Error: 
CommandNotFoundError: Your shell has not been properly configured to use 'conda activate'.
If using 'conda activate' from a batch script, change your
invocation to 'CALL conda.bat activate'.

To initialize your shell, run

    $ conda init <SHELL_NAME>

Currently supported shells are:
  - bash
  - cmd.exe
  - fish
  - tcsh
  - xonsh
  - zsh
  - powershell

See 'conda init --help' for more information and options.

IMPORTANT: You may need to close and restart your shell after running 'conda init'.


**My MLproject file:**
name: testproject

conda_env: conda.yaml

entry_points:
  main:
    command: "python mlflowtrace.py"

Am i missing a setting or is there an alternate path?
